articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
You know, this is the time of year where Chris normally publishes a big ol’ reflection of the past year. The first one was published in 2007, the same year CSS-Tricks began, and it continued all the way through 2021…

articles.description:

articles.description:
CSS Container Queries are still gaining traction and many of us are getting our hands wet with them, even if it’s for little experiments or whatnot. They’ve got great, but not quite full, browser support — enough to justify using …

We’ve accomplished a bunch of stuff in this series! We created a custom WordPress block that fetches data from an external API and renders it on the front end. Then we took that work and extended it so the data …

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sara Dholakia)
articles.description: In this article, Sara Dholakia presents a guide on how to choose just the right type of data visualization, with guidelines and things to keep in mind.
articles.title: A Guide To Getting Data Visualization Right

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: That’s how people behave on the web in 2023. Some observations from real usability testing on what people do and what they don’t do on the web. From disabled copy-paste to magic link sign-in.
articles.title: The State Of Usability In 2023 🎊

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2023!
articles.title: Opening The Doors To 2023 (January Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ruslan Yevych)
articles.description: In this article, Ruslan Yevych will show you an easy way how to predict the appearance of a problem known as WCAG Failure Under 1.4.4 Resize Text (AA) while zooming the page. You will have a clear understanding of the possible risks of using responsive typography at the stage of development.
articles.title: Fluid Typography: Predicting A Problem With Your User’s Zoom-In

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alvin Bryan)
articles.description: No more random scripts in Python and JavaScript to transform CSV or JSON data. In this article, Alvin Bryan shows you how to use Miller, a small and powerful CLI tool, to do all your data processing.
articles.title: A Guide To Command-Line Data Manipulation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nicolas Hoffmann)
articles.description: You may have already heard of CSS logical properties or RTL adaptations but are still deciding whether to deploy them widely. To help raise your awareness of their possibilities, Nicolas Hoffmann shares his experience of how he and his team at Proton carried out a massive move from CSS logical props to production and how you can consider them from a different perspective in your very own projects.
articles.title: Deploying CSS Logical Properties On Web Apps

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: In this article, Thomas Bohm shares strategies and methods to tackle some common graphic communication problems and gives you insights into how to improve accessibility and usability and make your designs much better.
articles.title: Useful Accessibility And Usability Examples To Help Improve Your Designs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Masha Shaposhnikova)
articles.description: In this article, Masha goes over five tips that make it easier to manage a design system while increasing its effectiveness. This short guide is aimed at smaller teams.
articles.title: Taking The Stress Out Of Design System Management

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ashish Bogawat)
articles.description: In this article, Ashish Bogawat shares some of his favorite ways how to boost productivity and do things faster, better, and probably more fun by using efficient tools and workflows.
articles.title: Boosting Productivity For Designers With Efficient Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Suzanne Scacca)
articles.description: Concerns over online privacy and security are nothing new. In this article, Suzanne Scacca explores how the right CSV importer can help businesses better prioritize user security.
articles.title: How To Prioritize User Security When Collecting Offline Data

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Heather Burns)
articles.description: All of us want to create inclusive, safe, and privacy-aware digital experiences, but where to begin? Our brand new Smashing Book, “Understanding Privacy,” written by Heather Burns, can help you lay the ground for future developers, designers, and project managers to build a better web for tomorrow. [Jump to the details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) or [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: Protect Your Users, Protect Yourself

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.
articles.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Keima Kai)
articles.description: In this article, Keima Kai provides a brief history of AI in web design, explores its current implications for creativity, and offers suggestions for how web designers can stay ahead of the curve.
articles.title: The Future Of Design: Human-Powered Or AI-Driven?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: “Understanding Privacy,” the new Smashing Book by Heather Burns, will help you create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. Print books are now shipping! [Jump to details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) and [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).
articles.title: It’s Here! “Understanding Privacy,” A New Smashing Book Is Shipping Now

articles.author: Sule-Balogun Olanrewaju Ganiu
articles.description: Logs are records of the events happening with your application. Laravel, by default, writes log information into the laravel.log file that ships with a fresh Laravel installation. The file is housed within the storage > logs  directory.  In this tutorial, you'll learn the following:  * Introduction to
articles.title: How Logging Works in Laravel Applications

articles.author: Reed Barger
articles.description: Hooks are one of the most powerful features of React.  They enable us to easily reuse functionality across our application's components. What's best about hooks is their reusability – you can reuse your hooks both across components and your projects. Here are seven of the most important React hooks
articles.title: React Hooks You Can Use in Every Project – Explained with Examples

articles.author: Jennifer Bland
articles.description: One of the best ways to learn CSS is by creating something useful while you learn. I will show you how to use the following CSS concepts by creating the YouTube logo:  * Flexbox  * The border-radius property  * How to create a triangle in CSS What
articles.title: Learn CSS by Building the YouTube Logo in Pure CSS

articles.author: Chigozie Oduah
articles.description: In this article, we will explore the various ways you can use modifiers in Solidity to modify the behavior of functions.  We will cover topics such as the syntax for defining and using modifiers, the _;  symbol, using multiple modifiers on a single function, modifiers with arguments, enum-based
articles.title: What Are Solidity Modifiers? Explained with Examples

articles.author: David Clinton
articles.description: Whatever your connection to technology, security should play a prominent role in the way you think and act.  Technology, after all, amplifies the impact of everything we do with it. The things we say and write using communication technologies can be read and heard by many, many more people
articles.title: A Beginner's Guide to Digital Security – How to Keep Yourself Safe Online

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: If you want to learn to code and get a job as a developer, you're in the right place. This book will show you how. And yes this is the full book – for free – right here on this webpage. A few years back, one of the Big 5
articles.title: How to Learn to Code & Get a Developer Job in 2023 [Full Book]

articles.author: Zaira Hira
articles.description: Managing files from the command line is one of the most common tasks for a Linux user.  Files are created, edited, deleted, and used by many of the background OS processes. Files are also used by regular users to accomplish daily tasks such as taking notes, writing code, or
articles.title: How to Make a File in Linux from the Command Line – Create a File in the Terminal

articles.author: Austin Gil
articles.description: Today I'm going to show you all the things to consider when building the perfect HTML input. Despite its seemingly simple nature, there's actually a lot that goes into it. How to Make the Control  Well, we need to start somewhere. Might as well start with the control itself.
articles.title: How to Build Great HTML Form Controls

articles.author: Dionysia Lemonaki
articles.description: When working with files in Python, there may be times when you need to check whether a file exists or not. But why should you check if a file exists in the first place? Confirming the existence of a specific file comes in handy when you want to perform particular
articles.title: How to Check if a File Exists in Python with isFile() and exists()

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: You can convert variables from one data type to another in Java using different methods.  In this article, you'll learn how to convert integers to strings in Java in the following ways:  * Using the Integer.toString() method.   * Using the String.valueOf() method.   * Using
articles.title: Int to String in Java – How to Convert an Integer into a String
